repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: Cursor shape changes are working but `imgcat` of iTerm2 still doesn't work, I guess Neovim/libuv/ncurses library/something is changing terminal mode/settings. I don't have much knowledge about that but if I write the exact same bytes to a file and `tail -f` that file in another tab of iTerm2, image shows correctly, but in Neovim it shows like this:

comment_data.body: doesn't look like this is used anywhere?

wonder what the difference is vs `vterm_screen_set_unrecognised_fallbacks` which is used in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22159 .
looks like they are equivalent:
https://github.com/neovim/libvterm/blob/9d6d2112335080312ef8c36667fa717ded4f7daf/src/screen.c#L1064-L1067
is the "erase the unfocused cursor" comment still relevant?

Do you think this PR is still relevant considering the changes in the past months? (specially the changes in libvterm)
Also we have [this PR](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22159) which I think is better approaching this issue.
If this PR is still relevant I'm willing to rebase it and continue working on it.
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22159 is definitely the ideal direction, but the :terminal cursor changes in this PR still seem relevant?
Yeah, I think it should be good, so is it a good idea to rebase this on top of #22159 and rename it to "remove virtual cursor in terminals in favor of real terminal cursor"?
Yes. Going to try to merge https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22159 today

comment_regular_data.body: This is probably not wanted for remote UIs. Maybe the approach in #11290 is better?

I removed the virtual cursor in tui to show the real cursor. Now lots of tests are failing because they expect the `{reverse = true}` attribute to show the cursor position (`{1: }` most of the time) while it has changed to `^` (I think this is the real cursor indicator) now.
So lots of snapshots need to be updated, my question is: do we have a mechanism like jest --update-snapshots or should it be done manually for each test?

> I removed the virtual cursor in tui to show the real cursor. 

That's definitely something we want! https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/3681

> Now lots of tests are failing ... do we have a mechanism like `jest --update-snapshots`

No. Will have to be done manually, though should be fairly easy to do with `:cdo`?
